predicate.note: Frames file for 'schedule' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus and comparison with 'plan'

roleset.name: plan a time
roleset.note: The arg3 "time of event" is entirely separate from the time of scheduling which will take an argM-TMP.

example.name: active
example.text: Nissan scheduled a seven-yen interim dividend payment, unchanged.
example.arg: a seven-yen interim dividend payment, unchanged

example.name: passivized and extracted
example.text: ...the first of five small fields scheduled *trace* to be brought into production before the end of 1990.
example.arg: to be brought into production before the end of 1990

example.name: passivized, temporal
example.text: A guild disciplinary hearing is scheduled *trace* next Monday in New York

example.name: apparent temporal--but not!
example.text: ...the multilevel railcars, scheduled *trace* for delivery in 1990...

roleset.note: Because the phrase "for delivery in 1990" includes an action, not just a time, it counts as an arg2 not an arg3.

example.name: contrasting temporals
example.text: Today John scheduled a dentist appointment for next week.
